unhcr default (web/sRGB) Primary color palette

Source: R/unhcr_color_def.R
unhcr_pal.Rd

UNHCR primary color palette. unhcr_pal provides the default UNHCR color palette as a data frame containing 11 colors.

This is the primary (web/sRGB) scale.

See https://media.unhcr.org/archive/Brand-Book-for-external-partners-2CZ7A2P0CGAY.html for details.

unhcr_pal

Format

An object of class data.frame with 1 rows and 11 columns.

See also

unhcr_pal_blue for the UNHCR default blue palette; unhcr_pal_primary for a UNHCR color palette with primary colors; seecol to show color palettes; usecol to use color palettes.

Other color palettes: unhcr_pal_blue, unhcr_pal_darkblue, unhcr_pal_graphic, unhcr_pal_green, unhcr_pal_grey, unhcr_pal_primary, unhcr_pal_red, unhcr_pal_yellow

Examples

{
unhcr_pal
dim(unhcr_pal)  # 1 11

# Access by position:
unhcr_pal[1]    # 1nd named color "blue5" (as df)
unhcr_pal[[1]]  # 2nd color value "#0072BC"

# Access by name:
unhcr_pal["blue5"]    # color "blue5" (as df)
unhcr_pal[["blue5"]]  # color value "#0072BC"

# Plotting palette:
seecol(unhcr_pal)
}
